ovdesc.p: This file holds the control codes and escape sequences for various terminal models.
It allows the user to define:-
(1) The terminal dependant escape sequences for the visual attributes used by T24, eg. Underline on/off, Reverse video on/off etc.
(2) The values returned by the function keys F1,F2,F3 etc.

(3) Special terminal initialisation sequences and commands to be performed just before signing onto T24. For example, set cursor type to solid block, display terminal status line, disable/enable break key etc.
Control characters are inserted in the format 'nnn', where nnn is the decimal ASCII value of the character, eg. 27 = 'escape' character.

desc.p: This field is used in conjunction with Deal Slip printing where the user requires a custome advices associated with the application and function. They can be produced automatically based on the function, or manually by this hot key and the function.
The input here defines the value returned by the print hot key

This sequence is normally downloaded into a function key for convenience. You will need to refer to your Terminal User Guide or the Emulation software help on how to map the function keys. When this key is depressed, during contract input, the Deal Slip processing is invoked. You can use either a Control Character or a keyword but bear in mind the trigger may have an impact on data being entered at the time.
If the word DEALSLIP is entered as the trigger you would map a function key with;
DEALSLIP<cr>
where <cr> implies a carriage return.
0-40 any characters.
Control characters need to be entered in the form <001> for CTRL A or <018> for CTRL R.

(Mandatory input) Details; The number entered here should be one of those listed by the "SET.TERM.TYPE" command of PRIME INFORMATION which relates to the specific terminal model being defined. For example, a TELEVIDEO 955 terminal is identified by the PRIME INFORMATION terminal type 2 (TV925).
Defines the initial terminal command sequences to be executed just before signing onto T24. These sequences can be used to set the cursor mode, screen blank period etc.
0-40 type A (alphanumeric) characters.
Defines the ascii values returned by the function keys F1,F2,F3 etc.

Note: For terminals whose function keys have been pre-set by the manufacturer and do not allow for them to be re-programmed, the ascii values returned by each F1,F2 etc should be entered here (FUNC KEY VALUES) and field 18.1 (FUNCTION KEYS) left blank.
It is important that the function keys only return single values. Keys which return more than one value will cause problems in certain T24 functions.

0-40 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Details; The acsii values returned by the function keys F1,F2,F3 etc should be specified here. If this field is left blank then the system assumes that the default values defined by the escape sequence in field 18.1 (FUNCTION KEYS) are going to be: FUNCTION KEY ASCII VALUE F1 21 F2 2 F3 6 F4 5 F5 22 F6 23 F7 20
